etymology.description: 电(electric) + 影(shadow/image) = motion picture (electrically projected images).
etymology.interpretation: Literally “electric shadows,” referring to images projected by electrical technology. Evokes early cinema’s moving shadows on a screen.
etymology.simplification: 電 was simplified to 电 to reduce strokes during character simplification; 影 remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我最喜欢看外国电影(我最喜歡看外國電影)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuì xǐhuan kàn wàiguó diànyǐng.
examples.english: I like watching foreign films the most.

examples.pinyin: Zhè bù diànyǐng zài diànyǐngyuàn shàngyìng.
examples.english: This movie is being released in theaters.

examples.chinese: 他对电影历史很感兴趣(他對電影歷史很感興趣)。
examples.pinyin: Tā duì diànyǐng lìshǐ hěn gǎn xìngqù.
examples.english: He is very interested in film history.
